poem:
**Between Silence and Sound**

In Istanbul, a phone rings,  
shattering the silence like a fragile vase;  
between the clamour of loss and hope  
her voice rises, threads of steel.  
China holds its breath;  
chains speak softly for those  
torn from flights unclaimed,  
straining against the pull of vanished time,  
as one heart unbolts the world.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. It had been four days since she last heard from him as he got ready to board a flight to Casablanca. The silence had been torturous. But the news Idris now shared with her was even worse. He had been arrested". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
